result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph G. Nestel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph G. Nestel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph G. Nestel was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE in full time employment/schooling or combination of the two and when not fully engaged, complete 10 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary by agent.  DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber release if meets jail criteria

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500) >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation. CONDITIONS: Serve 30 days MCJ, with huber release if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/ combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. No contact with A.L. Restitution will be set at separate hearing date. Zero days credit.
